column4: So you can access your server over SSH from other PCs, devices, etc. but not from your Ubuntu PC?
Can you ping the server from your Ubuntu PC?
nope i get a destination port unreachable when i try
What is between your Ubuntu PC and your server?  Is it over the local network or Internet, etc?
computer connects directly to the router
So your Ubuntu PC and your server are connected directly to the router?
no the ubuntu pc is connected to the router, my server is hosted in a datacenter
When using your ipad to connect to your server over ssh, are you doing it from your home network connection, or some other location, wifi hotspot, school, etc?
If you can access it from your ipad (or anything, for that matter), then port 22 is *not* blocked.

Is your server at the datacenter, "pingable" or is there filtering in place to block it?  If it's pingable, can you ping it from a different computer?  You already mentioned that you cannot ping it from your Ubuntu PC, correct?
Ok.  Seems to be a local issue with your Ubuntu box itself, especially since you have other devices locally that can ssh in just fine.
Have you added any packet filtering/firewalling or modified routing tables on the Ubuntu PC?
i may have found the problem, hang on
i got it, thanks for your time, it was moblock, it added some stuff into iptables
